intro: Ononis geminata, commonly known as the twinflower or lesser twinflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, with two petals that give it its common name. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often hairy, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to rocky soils. Ononis geminata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
